text: Uppsala University is a research university in Uppsala, Sweden, and the oldest university in Sweden, founded in 1477.Ridder-Symoens, Hilde de. A History of the University in Europe. Cambridge University Press, 2003; p. 84. The university rose to importance during the rise of Sweden as a great power at the end of the 16th century and was then given relative financial stability by the large gift from King Gustavus Adolphus in the early 17th century. Uppsala also has an important historical place in Swedish national culture, identity and for the Swedish establishment. Uppsala belongs to the Coimbra Group of European universities. The university has nine faculties in three 'disciplinary domains'. It has about 20,000 full-time students, and about 2,000 doctoral students. It has a teaching staff of 4,000 (part-time and full- time) out of a total of 6,000 employees. ==References== Category:Colleges and universities in Sweden Category:Uppsala Category:1477 establishments Category:1470s establishments in Europe Category:Schools in Sweden
title: Uppsala University
